title: Proxy Pac Ipv6
content:
Hi Guys,

my question is: Can Firefox support IPv6 in the Linux enviroment? Because my example below dosnt work and I dont know if IPv6 is really supported. If I use IPv4 the command below would work.

For example:

if(shExpMatch(host, "hi.test.de"){ 

   return "PROXY [fd99::1]:8080;" + "PROXY [fd99::2]:8080;";

}

Thanks for your answers.

title: Facebook Crashes Waterfox Classic v 2020.10
content: Generally, my Waterfox browser is great. Except when browsing Facebook pages. I'm at that site a lot, and if I'm uploading pictures, and roaming from page to page, after awhile the browser will slow down, or not respond at all > Task manager > Close browser > Restart > Repeat (a half hour or so later). I have absolutely no problems with any other sites I visit with this browser, just Facebook (and no problems with Facebook using Chrome or Edge). Thoughts and/or suggestions gratefully accepted. Thank you.
creator: waikapubruce

title: Migration problem
content: One year ago I switched from Thunderbird to Outlook (I was forced to do it by the IT-department at my work office). When I migrated I took a backup of all my e-mails from 2009 to 2019 by putting them in a map in Explorer - they are saved as .elm-files. Today I would like to import my elm-files to Outlook, which is easy (copy and paste). The problem is that Outlook doesn´t know how to sort my elm-files according to their original date. The original date is written in each of my elm-files, but Outlook dates them according to the day when I imported them to Outlook, which means that I can´t see my Thunderbird mails in Outlook in chronological order. Anybody who knows a good solution to this? I have Windows 10.
creator: LJV777

title: Comments in native JSON viewer breaks it
content:
I regularly use Firefox's native JSON viewer to visualize JSON files, today for the first time I noticed that if I put comments in a JSON file and try to view it in the native json viewer, it gives error.

title: since Raspberry Pi OS is using PulseAudio, Firefox 78.5.0esr does not play audio for some videos anymore.
content:
hi, i am using Firefox 78.5.0esr (32-bit) on my Raspberry Pi 4 (with 4GB). since the December 2020 update, Raspberry Pi OS is using PulseAudio as top overlay for ALSA, and Firefox 78.5.0esr does not play audio for some videos anymore.

the maintainers of Raspberry Pi OS told me that it is not an issue of them, it must be an issue of Firefox. they told, it is maybe an issue related to bug #1422073: no audio unless pulseaudio is already running but none of the suggestions there helped me.

here a link to a video that does not play audio in firefox, but play audio in chromium browser. https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=4Wrc4fHSCpw

i, tried to clean cache, reset preferences, removed add-ons, made a new clean installation on a new clean system, but nothing helped. all the time the same behavior - some videos does not play with audio in firefox, others do.

Raspberry Pi OS is an 32-bit opperating system for Raspberry Pi that has an ARM cpu, for those who don't know, what i am talking from. https://www.raspberrypi.org https://www.raspberrypi.org/forums/viewtopic.php?f=28&t=293746
creator: alpha-beta-release
